author: Special Correspondent
text:
Caught red-handed while accepting the money

M. Balasubramanian (46), Inspector of Nachiyarkoil police station in Thanjavur district, was arrested by the Directorate of Vigilance and Anti Corruption (DVAC) personnel on bribe charge on Thursday.

He was trapped in the police quarters when he allegedly received Rs. 8,000 as bribe from Bhupesh Gupta, a resident of Andakudaiyan and involved in contract works, from whom he had demanded the money for not filing a case against him on a complaint preferred by Ram Singh of the same place. Sources said the Inspector had instructed Bhupesh Gupta to bring the bribe to his quarters near the Nachiyarkoil police station on Thursday.

Acting on a complaint, the personnel caught the Inspector red handed when he received the bribe.

The bribe was seized and a case has been registered.
title: Inspector held on bribery charge
